description: Generate text using Amazon Bedrock LLMs with the modern Converse API for improved conversation handling. We recommend the Converse API for users who do not need to use custom models. It can be accessed using ChatBedrockConverse.

model_id.info: List of available model IDs to choose from.

aws_access_key_id.info: The access key for your AWS account. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID'.

aws_secret_access_key.info: The secret key for your AWS account. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'.

aws_session_token.info: The session key for your AWS account. Only needed for temporary credentials. Usually set in Python code as the environment variable 'AWS_SESSION_TOKEN'.

credentials_profile_name.info: The name of the profile to use from your ~/.aws/credentials file. If not provided, the default profile will be used.

region_name.info: The AWS region where your Bedrock resources are located.

endpoint_url.info: The URL of the Bedrock endpoint to use.

temperature.info: Controls randomness in output. Higher values make output more random.

max_tokens.info: Maximum number of tokens to generate.

top_p.info: Nucleus sampling parameter. Controls diversity of output.

top_k.info: Limits the number of highest probability vocabulary tokens to consider. Note: Not all models support top_k. Use 'Additional Model Fields' for manual configuration if needed.

disable_streaming.info: If True, disables streaming responses. Useful for batch processing.

additional_model_fields.info: Additional model-specific parameters for fine-tuning behavior.

success.model_initialized: Amazon Bedrock Converse model '{model}' initialized successfully in region '{region}'

errors.langchain_aws_not_installed: langchain_aws is not installed. Please install it with `pip install langchain_aws`.
errors.validation_error: ChatBedrockConverse validation error: {error}. This may be due to incompatible parameters for model '{model}'. Consider adjusting the model parameters or trying the legacy Amazon Bedrock component.
errors.converse_api_error: Converse API error: {error}. The model '{model}' may not support the Converse API. Try using the legacy Amazon Bedrock component instead.
errors.model_build_failed: Failed to build Amazon Bedrock Converse model: {error}

logs.access_key_added: AWS Access Key ID added to configuration
logs.secret_key_added: AWS Secret Access Key added to configuration
logs.session_token_added: AWS Session Token added to configuration
logs.profile_name_added: Credentials profile name '{profile}' added to configuration
